content: Cabinet of Singapore 2015–2020 The **Fourth Cabinet of Lee Hsien Loong** of the [Government](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) was announced on 28 September 2015 following the [2015 general election](/wiki/2015_Singaporean_general_election) on 11 September, and came into effect on 1 October 2015. The day after the election, [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) told the media that he would form the [Cabinet](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore) within two weeks. ## Changes PositionIncomingOutgoing[Minister for Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore))[Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung)Minister for Education[Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng)[Minister for Transport](/wiki/Ministry_of_Transport_(Singapore))[Lui Tuck Yew](/wiki/Khaw_Boon_Wan)Minister in the [Prime Minister's Office](/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Singapore))[Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng) ## Initial composition ### Cabinet Prior to the general election held on 11 September 2015, [Transport Minister](/wiki/Minister_for_Transport_(Singapore)) [Lui Tuck Yew](/wiki/Lui_Tuck_Yew) announced his retirement on 11 August. All other incumbent office holders successfully defended their parliamentary seats in the elections. The list of Cabinet ministers and other office-holders was announced on 28 September 2015. In a press conference, [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) said, "I have given heavy responsibilities to the next generation of Ministers. They will be stretched and tested. They have to prove themselves and must gel together as a team. Soon after the end of this term, we must have a new team ready to take over from me." Three veteran ministers were named Coordinating Ministers, each of them overseeing a handful of ministries. - National Security – [Teo Chee Hean](/wiki/Teo_Chee_Hean). - Economic and Social Policies – [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam). - Infrastructure – [Khaw Boon Wan](/wiki/Khaw_Boon_Wan). MinisterPrior to 2015Appointment[Lui Tuck Yew](/wiki/Lui_Tuck_Yew)[Minister for Transport](/wiki/Minister_for_Transport_(Singapore))Retired from politics.[Khaw Boon Wan](/wiki/Khaw_Boon_Wan)[Minister for National Development](/wiki/Minister_for_National_Development_(Singapore))Moved to Minister for Transport.[Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong)[Minister for Culture, Community and Youth](/wiki/Minister_for_Culture,_Community_and_Youth)Moved to Minister for National Development.[Grace Fu](/wiki/Grace_Fu)Minister in Prime Minister's Office, Second Minister for Environment and Water Resources, Second Minister for Foreign AffairsMoved to Minister for Culture, Community and Youth.[Amy Khor](/wiki/Amy_Khor)Senior Minister of State for Health and ManpowerRelinquished Senior Minister of State for Manpower and moved to Senior Minister of State for Environment and Water Resources.[Teo Ser Luck](/wiki/Teo_Ser_Luck)Minister of State for Trade and IndustryRelinquished Minister of State for Trade and Industry, and moved to Minister of State for Manpower. Several other ministers will have a change in duties: - [Vivian Balakrishnan](/wiki/Vivian_Balakrishnan) – from Environment and Water Resources to Foreign Affairs. - [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) – from Foreign Affairs to Home Affairs, while retaining Law. - [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat) – from Education to Finance. - [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) – from Culture, Community and Youth to National Development. - [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli) – from the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) to Environment and Water Resources. - [Grace Fu](/wiki/Grace_Fu) – from the PMO to Culture, Community and Youth. The [Ministry of Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) and [Ministry of Trade and Industry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Trade_and_Industry_(Singapore)) will each have two full ministers, covering separate aspects. Chinese persons, and the [personal names](/wiki/Personal_name) of Indian and Malay persons (except for Vivian Balakrishnan and Tharman Shanmugaratnam, where they indicate surnames as well). title: Fourth Lee Hsien Loong Cabinet
